item.title: Andy add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Andy add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Since each story presents its own technical problems, obviously one can't generalize about them on a two-times-two-equals-four basis. Finding the right form for your story is simply to realize the most natural way of telling the story. The test of whether or not a writer has defined the natural shape of his story is just this: After reading it, can you imagine it differently, or does it silence your imagination and seem to you absolute and final? As an orange is final. As an orange is something nature has made just right." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Andy add a quote by Robert M. Pirsig
item.description: "The only Zen you find on tops of mountains is the Zen you bring there." -- Robert M. Pirsig

item.title: Andy add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "From 30 feet away she looked like a lot of class. From 10 feet away she looked like something made up to be seen from 30 feet away." -- Raymond Chandler
